meanings.definition: To observe (a day) or commemorate (an event) with ceremonies or festivities.
meanings.sent1: We celebrate birthdays with cake and balloons.
meanings.sent2: The whole town gathered to celebrate the Fourth of July.
meanings.sent3: Let's celebrate the end of the school year with a picnic!
meanings.sent4: The community came together to celebrate their unity and strength.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the air as they celebrated their friendship.

meanings.sent1: The mayor will celebrate the new law in a speech.
meanings.sent2: The company will celebrate the product launch in a press release.
meanings.sent3: Let's celebrate the good news with a banner in the town square!
meanings.sent4: The announcement will celebrate the achievements of the team.
meanings.sent5: The radio broadcast will celebrate the success of the charity event.

meanings.sent1: We celebrate the chef's delicious cooking at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The fans celebrate the singer's talent at every concert.
meanings.sent3: Let's celebrate the artist's work by displaying it in the gallery.
meanings.sent4: The community will celebrate the hero's bravery in a parade.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will celebrate the student's hard work with an award.
